dct_title_s: New map of that portion of North America exhibiting the United States and territories, the Canadas, New Brunswick, Nova Scotia and Mexico, also Central America and the West India Islands
dct_description_sm: engraved and printed by A. Hoen & Co., Lithographers and Engravers, Balto.
Bar scale on map given in "miles".
Includes legend and two tables: Names of the counties and county towns in the United States -- Table of distances. Routes by Water. Inland Routes.

Shows topography, drainage, cities and towns, railroads, roads, canals, land routes (e.g.: Oregon T., including "stopping places on route to Oregon"), and ocean routes (e.g.: U.S. Exploring Expedition 1841).
Descriptive text throughout, e.g.: Believed by Mr. Leroux to be an open prairie and a good route, if water can be had.
"Entered according to Act of Congress in the year 1850 by Jacob Monk in the Clerks Office of the District of Maryland."

Collector's note: The central part of California is colored yellow to represent the gold region. There is possibly an 1850 edition; and editions for the years 1851, 1852, 1853 (in at least two states), 1854 (in at leasst two states), 1856, 1857,1858.
Inset map: [New map of the world Mercators projection].
dct_rights_sm: Image from the Warren Heckrotte Map Collection courtesy Stanford University Libraries. This item is in the public domain.  There are no restrictions on use.  If you have questions, please contact the David Rumsey Map Center at rumseymapcenter@stanford.edu.
